title: Arsenal news: Laurent Koscielny is club's most important player, says Pat Nevin | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 5:00 pm Arsenal can’t cope without Laurent Koscielny, says Pat Nevin (Picture: Getty) 
Former Chelsea star Pat Nevin has suggested that Laurent Koscielny is in fact Arsenal ‘s most important player after they fell apart without him on the pitch against Bayern Munich. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
The Gunners were level at 1-1 when Koscielny went off injured at the Allianz Arena, but conceded just four minutes after he left the field to be replaced by Gabriel. 
Arsenal then totally capitulated as they let in three goals in ten minutes and then one more late on to give themselves a mountain to climb for their second leg clash at the Emirates Stadium. Koscielny’s injury allowed Bayern to tear Arsenal apart (Picture: Getty) 
While there has been much talk about the club’s fears of losing contract rebels Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez, Nevin says this result shows how crucial Koscielny is to their cause. 
‘It’s fantastic that he is a top, world class player and he has stayed at Arsenal for so long,’ Nevin told BBC 5 Live.
